title: Alabama QB Tua Tagovailoa will miss at least one game with ankle injury
text:
CLOSE USA TODAY Sports' Paul Myerberg breaks down the latest Amway Coaches Poll. USA TODAY

A high-ankle sprain will keep Alabama quarterback Tua Tagovailoa from taking the field Oct. 26 when the top-ranked Crimson Tide host Arkansas.

Alabama coach Nick Saban announced Sunday the Heisman Trophy candidate suffered the injury in the first half of Saturday's 35-13 win over Tennessee.

"Our physicians performed a successful tight-rope procedure on his right ankle this morning. This is the same injury, but the opposite ankle that Tua injured last season," Saban said in a statement, adding he expected his star quarterback to make a "full and speedy recovery."

Tagovailoa was replaced by backup Mac Jones, who is expected to get the start against Arkansas. The Crimson Tide have a bye the following week, so Tagovailoa could potentially return for a showdown at home against No. 3 LSU on Nov. 9.
description: Alabama quarterback Tagovailoa had a procedure on his right ankle and will not play vs. Arkansas, but team expects "full and speedy recovery."
